column4: i like to keep one that works out the box just incase i get any problems...i use an LM technologies USB one and it works perfectly...just seems to be laptop ones i've had problems with
but...having said that..i've never not got one to work...eventually they all work with me
yes, but with how much hassle (or ndiswrapper)
only one took longer than 10 mins
pretty much all videocards have 2 connectors nowadays
then it's useless and your 8400gs will be way better, even when it's a crappy card itsel
so you think i should get one card that has 2 outputs rather than 2 cards?
yes. and a decent one. what mobo/cpu?
and what usage for the PC?
the 8400gs will be as fast or faster than your built in card
the pc is just a general home computer
play _any_ games?
only xmoto really
yes I understand, but: what mobo is it?
i was basically asking...is the nvidia 8400GS any good lol
not really but your needs are very simple
however builtin graphics will cost you performance of your CPU/memory bus
Intel 946GZ + ICH7
ick. what cpu?
Intel Dual Core E2180
I have a e2160. very nice CPU but on a p35 board
I'd advise you to get one as well
